How do Urban Kenyans Consume Media?

WhatsApp

Across the board, WhatsApp Groups were most widely referenced by respondents to monitor and share news with friends, colleagues, and family.

Radio &

Newspapers

Respondents of a variety of ages and socioeconomic statuses referenced using radio and newspapers to cross-reference news they read online.

Torrented

Movies

Watching torrented movies was common among a variety of ages, but more often cited with younger respondents.

Television

Older respondents, and those with lower-socioeconomic statuses, seemed to consume more TV—while young respondents largely avoided programed TV, choosing Youtube or other internet-first providers.

Web

Browsing

Facebook

& Twitter

Respondents mostly browsed online using mobile phones, either through a search bar on their device’s home screen or through light-weight applications.

Generally, Facebook use is more common than Twitter. But, respondents with an interest in media cited Twitter as useful for finding and sharing news with the “right people.”
